intro: Spermacoce pazensis, commonly known as the Pazentis moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce pazensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
